Description: Terracotta figure of Aphrodite naked. Aphrodite standing, propped on a pier. She is of Medici type with a dolphin beside her left leg. Her hands protect her breasts and pubic area and, although her head is lost, her hair was drawn back with a tail hanging down the centre of her upper back. She wears armlets and anklets (not shown at the rear). A short pier with a moulded capital supports her buttocks at the back. Hollow; two-piece mould. Micaceous brown Nile silt, covered overall with a red-brown slip fired dark brown in places.
Curator's comments: BM Terracotta IV Comparandum. Close, probably same mould-series: Dunand 1990: no. 3, dated Roman period. Bibliog. Fischer 1994: no. 913.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3353)
Condition: Head lost. The feet are broken away, together with the base of the pier and any plinth the figure might have had.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
